Name.BusinessNameLine1: SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROTECT AND SHELTER THE SICK AND THE INJURED, THE HOMELESS AND THE UNWANTED ANIMALS. FIND LOVING, NEW HOMES FOR HOMELESS ANIMALS. EDUCATE THE PUBLIC CONCERNING THE HUMANE CARE OF ALL ANIMALS. ASSIST IN THE ENFORCEMENT OF LAWS AND ORDINANCES FOR ANIMAL PROTECTION.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROTECT AND SHELTER THE SICK AND THE INJURED, THE HOMELESS AND THE UNWANTED ANIMALS. FIND LOVING, NEW HOMES FOR HOMELESS ANIMALS. EDUCATE THE PUBLIC CONCERNING THE HUMANE CARE OF ALL ANIMALS. ASSIST IN THE ENFORCEMENT OF LAWS AND ORDINANCES FOR ANIMAL PROTECTION.
IRS990.Description: PREVENT CRUELTY TO ANIMALS, AFFORD RELIEF TO SUCH ANIMALS WHEN SICK, INJURED OR IN DISTRESS, ASSIST IN THE PLACING OF UNWANTED OR ABANDONED ANIMALS IN APPROPRIATE, QUALIFIED HOMES. Historically animal organizations have provided "Shelter Services" that focus on crisis intervention: admitting and adopting unwanted animals, doing abuse and neglect investigations, treating sick and injured animals, and supporting spay/neuter programs. For over 60 years the SPCA of Pinellas County has provided these types of services for homeless, abused, sick and injured pets in our community. However, the SPCA also has an additional goal - - to keep pets out of animal shelters. To make this possible the SPCA initiates and provides "Programs" to the community that proactively seek to prevent animal overpopulation and abandonment problems. By enhancing these programs the SPCA proposes to: Reduce the number of pets in animal shelters because of behavior problems. Some 70% of animals turned into shelters throughout America are turned in because of behavior issues. The SPCA has implemented a comprehensive behavior program to: make Shelter pets more adoptable, help adopted animals stay in their new homes, help pet owners in the community resolve pet behavior issues and keep their pets at home, help other Shelters implement behavior programs. Reduce Pet Overpopulation by helping pet owners understand the impact of pet overpopulation, the benefits of spaying and neutering their pets and how to access existing services. The SPCA's existing Friends of Family Pets program provides spay/neuter services to limited income residents and will continue to grow to meet the demand for these services.

Activity2.Description: PROMOTE KINDNESS TO AND CONSIDERATION OF ANIMALS THROUGH EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC ON PET CARE. Humane education and training are the keys to ensuring a more humane future for companion animals. To make this possible the SPCA initiates and provides "Programs" to the community that proactively seek to prevent animal overpopulation and abandonment problems. By enhancing these programs the SPCA proposes to: Reduce violence, abuse and neglect that result from ignorance and the inability to empathize with the needs and feeling of others. Animal Abuse is an "indicator crime" for other types of violent crimes such as child, spousal and elder abuse. The SPCA plans to enhance its existing training programs for Law Enforcement and Social Service providers. By helping these professionals identify and respond to animal abuse the SPCA can have a major impact on reducing violence in our community. Instill respect for life, responsibility and compassion for all living things as a basic value. This includes encouraging empathy and the love of pets among children - - children whose attitudes are in the formative stages and who will be the leaders and decision-makers of tomorrow. The plan is to dramatically increase the number of interactive educational programs being offered and the number of children reached by the SPCA's humane education programs, as well as, strengthen teacher education "in-service" training efforts.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF SEVERAL INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAVE INTERPRETED THE WISHES OF DONORS AND STATE LAW AS REQUIRING THE PRESERVATION OF THE FAIR VALUE OF THE ORIGINAL GIFT AS OF THE GIFT DATE OF THE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ABSENT EXPLICIT DONOR STIPULATIONS TO THE CONTRARY.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENT: -35453.
INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEES: 18602. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENT: 35453.

THE SOCIETY HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(c)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. INCOME EARNED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. THE SOCIETY IS TREATED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, AND NOT AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE SOCIETY HAS ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF ASC TOPIC 740 RELATING TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND DOES NOT BELIEVE IT HAS ANY MATERIAL INCOME TAX EXPOSURE RELATING TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE SOCIETY'S INCOME TAX FILINGS FOR PERIODS AFTER THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2006 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND ACCOUNTING MANAGER. ONCE IT HAS BEEN APPROVED, IT IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR, MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ASKED TO SIGN AN "ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT" REAFFIRMING THEIR ACKNOWLEGEMENT OF THE POLICY. IT IS REQUIRED THAT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AND OTHER REPRESENTATIVES SUBMIT A "DETERMINATION LETTER" IN THE EVENT THAT THEY NEED TO REQUEST FOR DETERMINATION CONCERNING POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE MARKET AND COMPETITION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. FORM 990 AS WELL AS THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
